posts.content:
Right you lot i think you are in the know.

I am going to build an engine and want to know what you boys and girls run what cc and heads cam etc??
i got the turbo ecu etc so just the case and and the bits that go in it sorry you can tell i am not into engines.

I will build it up slowly as i am running a new 1641 for now and was going to put the turbo unit on that but thinking i may do another lump.


Thanks sky

You cant really just put a turbo on a normal engine, You have to look at total seal rings, Compresssion ratio, Camshafts purposely for turbo applications etc etc.

And if you say you dont know much aqbout engines but your going to build one I would highly recommend you go and buy some 'how to books'
SSP sell lots of books relating to turbocharging and basic engine building.

have a look at my basic build thread to see whats involved.

viewtopic.php?f=8&t=64156&start=15

good luck and take your time it will be worth it in the end.

However if it is a standard engine then you will probably find that you can just turbocharge it, there are quite a few people on shoptalkforums that have done this as the stock cam is okay and standard compression is low
I see i have a look at your thread and i think about it and yer i have herd of people putting a turbo on standard engine ok
I wouldnt put a turbo on a stock motor with stock parts, I cant see the engine lasting long if you did what with the extra stresses put on the moving parts.
i have a 1641 and was going to put spacers on head to sort comprestion out and change the springs and have the boost low so wont blow engine up
